The question refers to the image shown.
© Galleria degli Uffizi, Florence, Italy / The Bridgeman Art Library
content.question: The subject matter of Fruit and Insects would have appealed to its original patrons because its

choices.label: lush display of fruits and grains would have prompted thoughts of their Christian faith
overt references to sin and decay would have aligned with their religious beliefs
fantastical representations of insects would have conflicted with contemporary scientific studies
emphasis on the natural world would have affirmed the patrons’ ambivalence about Christianity

content.answer: lush display of fruits and grains would have prompted thoughts of their Christian faith

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
